steps.title: Launch the app (all tests)
details: First visual impression already shows inconsistent button styling and cramped layout.

steps.title: Click “Add Task” on dashboard
details: 4 of 5 tests succeed; 1 test (“Pin a Task”) fails – button keeps moving/animating, click never stabilises (timeout after 5 s).
UI review flags inconsistent button size and margin.

steps.title: Wait for “Add New Task” modal
details: Modal appears but internal layout problems reported: mis-aligned labels, uneven padding, typography inconsistencies.

steps.title: Fill in Task Name / Description / Deadline
details: Fields accept input, but every screenshot notes label alignment / spacing / font-size issues.
Deadline field occasionally requires a retry before date picker opens.

steps.title: Select Categories
details: Category combobox works, but its dropdown stays open and later blocks other controls (pointer-event interception).
Padding inside list items feels cramped.

steps.title: Pick Color
details: 3 separate tests cannot locate the Color section or color picker component at all – hard failure that stops the flow.

steps.title: Choose Emoji
details: Never reached in tests that failed at Color step; remains pending.

steps.title: Submit with “Create Task”
details: Two journeys (Mark as Not Done, Drag & Move) fail because the still-open category menu intercepts clicks on the Create Task button (pointer events).
Error log shows repeated retries until timeout.

steps.title: Post-submit feedback (success message / list update)
details: Because users cannot successfully submit, no confirmation, pinning, marking done, or moving tasks is ever exercised.

emotional_arc: Initial curiosity and confidence → mild visual annoyance (crowded UI) → growing irritation as inputs feel sloppy → sharp frustration when Color picker is missing → repeated clicking on disabled Create Task adds anxiety → eventual abandonment when nothing can be saved.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Mis-aligned labels and uneven spacing make the form feel unpolished and increase cognitive load, reducing trust and completion rate.
next_actions: Adopt a grid or flexbox layout with consistent 8-pt spacing system.
Align labels above or left of inputs consistently; use design-system form components.
Run quick hallway test to verify readability before shipping.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent styling weakens brand perception; unstable buttons block critical actions (Add Task, Create Task).
next_actions: Define primary / secondary button variants in the theme and reuse tokens.
Remove or dampen entrance animations so Playwright (and humans) can click reliably.
Increase hit-area to at least 44 × 44 px for accessibility.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Open menus intercept pointer events, preventing form submission and causing hard failures.
next_actions: Auto-close category menu on selection or on outside click.
Ensure z-index and pointer-events do not cover Create Task once menu is closed.
Write regression test that verifies Create Task is clickable after choosing a category.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users expect to personalise tasks; absence blocks progression and raises doubts about app stability.
next_actions: Verify component is rendered inside modal; if feature not ready, hide trigger and adjust copy.
Add fallback palette or default colour to unblock flow.
Update e2e test once component is stable.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Unclear headings and inconsistent font sizes slow scanning and harm accessibility.
next_actions: Use H1/H2/H3 semantic tags with defined font-scale.
Audit with automated accessibility tools (axe) for colour contrast and heading order.
Document typography guidelines in Figma / Storybook.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Low contrast fails WCAG AA, excluding low-vision users and hurting brand credibility.
next_actions: Run contrast checker on palette; adjust text or background colours.
Add CSS variables for primary / secondary / surface colours linked to brand guidelines.

first_tackles.description: Auto-close category dropdown and ensure it cannot block the Create Task button (quick JS fix, unblocks form submission).
Render or temporarily disable the Color picker so users can progress past that step.
Standardise primary/secondary button component to eliminate style drift and click-instability.
Apply a base spacing / alignment style sheet to modal form (one CSS pass cleans up 80 % of layout comments).
Run automated contrast & accessibility linting to catch colour and hierarchy issues early.
